column4: Hi there - I have an Ubuntu virtual machine running.  How do I configure multiple monitors on it?  Currently the display is just mirrored across the monitors.
depends though. if using nvidia, you'd need to use their tool
and a virtual machine, who knows what the display pretends to be...
probably intel, so that should work
right, I'm not using Nvidia (it's a macbook pro).  Under monitor preferences, I'm only seeing one.  Maybe if I restart the VM it will work?
virtual machine probably not exposing it then
that's possible.  Let me play with the settings a little more.  Thanks :)
I'd suggest tech support for your VM software.  virtualbox is in #vbox
you might also need guest additions. both vmware and vbox have those
I don't know what guest additions are.  And yes I went to the #vmware chat, they referred me to a site that told me to change the display settings in the guest OS
guest additions integrate the guest and host better. they are hooks into the guest VM
often guest ends up w/ nicer gfx cards exposed, instead of just VGA
VM is hit or miss though. hard to get specific advice on it. for example, using moka5 over here, I ended up having to hardcode lines for vmware into the xorg.conf
stupid vmware driver was being stupid about exposing monitor settings
thanks.  I don't think I have any hardware graphics acceleration on this host.  Maybe if I restart the VM it will work, but it's not such a big deal because I have a lot of monitor space. :)
anyway. definitely try vmware guest additions
thank you.  I will investigate into what "guest additions" are. :)
